intro: Erythrocoma triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered erythrocoma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. The flowers bloom in clusters of three, giving the plant its common name and contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
